Apparatus.Commentary: There is an old discussion about the inclusion or not of the šnūman in this Frauuarāne, see N2.15-5 (see "ritual information). The statement of the Nērangestān concerns, however, only the case when the rāspīg was not there for the recitation of Y63.1 and Y63.2..

Ritual.Quotations:
Cf. N2.14-5 (cf. Kotwal and Kreyenbroek, 1995: pp. 36 ff.):
zōt zūd abāz bawēd aṣ̌əm vohū 3 frauuarānē mazdaiiasnō zaraθuštriš cē gāh dārēd ud šnūman abāz ōšmurišnīh u-š wāz abāz gīrišnīh
dād ī farrox pus guft hād [az] pōryōtkēšān ēn nērang [[ē]] mānēd kū zōt pad yašt ī pad ātaxš sar wāz be gōwēd ud šnūman abāz nē ōšmārēnd
"The zōt beginns immediately again. (He recites) three Aṣ̌əm Vohū, the frauuarāne mazdaiiasnō zaraθuštriš that contains the gāh and the recitation of the šnūman. They (zōt and rāspīg) take again the wāz.
Dād, the son of Farrox, said: 'A ritual instruction remains from the pōryōtkēšān, namely, that The zōt says the wāz at the end of the yašt for the fire and they (zōt and rāspīg) do not recite the šnūman again.'"
